greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest k <= n such that k and (2n-sigma(n)) [= A033879(n)] are relatively prime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: (PARI) A325976(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); forstep(k=n, 0, -1, if(1==gcd((n+n-s), k), return(k))); };
A325817(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); for(i=0, s, if(1==gcd(n-i, n-(s-i)), return(i))); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 01 2019
